answer:
In BC, we can provide the measles, mumps, rubella (MMR) vaccine to Infants from 6-11 months of age who are traveling to an area where measles is usually found. As you are travelling with a 3-month old infant, contact a travel health clinic for recommendations for you and your family. Our travellers information section is here.
Immunization Nurse
question: Can my 3 month old have the measles vaccine? We are traveling to an area with a known outbreak.
question_variation_0: can 3 month olds get vaccine for measles
question_variation_1: can my three month old have the measles vaccine
